items.content_html:
Description

Update URLs of cited RFCs

Motivation

The previous link showed a warning and redirected to the new link

Additional details

I suppose similar changes should be made somewhere else
items.title: Fix 400 Bad Request spec URLs

items.content_html:
I used: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEventTiming/toJSON as the template.

I didn't add an example as:

  • these interfaces are deprecated
  • all properties/methods documented for these interfaces don't have one.

Crafting new examples for these interfaces would have be a loss of time.

This is part of openwebdocs/project#152
items.title: Add toJSON() to PerformanceTiming and PerformanceNavigation

items.content_html:
As part of openwebdocs/project#152, here is the addition of the missing CSSLayerStatementRule and CSSLayerBlockRule parts of the Cascade Layer feature. With this PR, all cascade layers APIs are documented.

Spec link: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-5/#layer-apis
items.title: Add missing CSSLayer*Rule interfaces

items.content_html:
Also includes box shadow, border image, and collapsing borders between table cells.

The list of related border properties are in the logical properties spec.
items.title: CSS Module: backgrounds and borders

items.content_html:
FF110 adds support for ContentVisibilityAutoStateChangedEvent object and the associated event contentvisibilityautostatechanged_event in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1798485

This is the release note.

Other docs work can be tracked in #23687
items.title: FF110Relnote: contentvisibilityautostatechanged event supported

items.content_html:
FF110 adds support for ContentVisibilityAutoStateChangedEvent object and the associated event contentvisibilityautostatechanged_event in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1798485

This updates the docs because this means that the API is no longer experimental.

Other docs work can be tracked in #23687
items.title: Ff110 contentvisibilityautostatechanged

items.content_html:
Description

Fix formatting and organization, clarify several imprecise statements, explain more of the relationships between timing properties.

Motivation

Existing docs make heavy reference to KeyframeEffect, which won't always be the only subtype of AnimationEffect, and isn't as near a parallel for getComputedTiming()'s use of timing properties as is getTiming(); use several terms without defining them; use vague terms like "not running"; don't cover a number of edge cases; miss several opportunities to document the dependencies/relationships between timing properties.

Additional details

More details on individual edits in the long commit notes.
items.title: Rewrite docs for `AnimationEffect.getComputedTiming()`

items.content_html:
currentColor is used, but the definition is nearly impossible to find, and many people don't know what it is. So, surfacing it. Also, it has special meaning in color, so defining it there.

Also, note I used currentColor and not currentcolor intentionally. Setting camel case enables screen readers to read it in a more helpful way. The spec has it lowercase, as do the rest of the docs, so am asking screen reader users what they prefer.

Is this similar to the rule to always remember to #camelCaseHashTagsWhereNormallyThereAreWordBreaks? Not sure.

DRAFT mode while waiting for feedback from the a11y folks I asked. But if there was already a discussion about this, please let me know.
items.title: currentColor: add definition and links

items.content_html:
CSS (size) container queries enabled by default in Fx 110.

Related issues and bugs:

  • parent issue #23683

Bugzilla:

  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1809720
items.title: relnote(110): CSS container queries enabled by default in 110

Description

Fix word order in explanation of SVG.
items.title: fix word order in explanation of SVG

items.content_html: This PR updates /learn/forms/how_to_structure_a_web_form based upon review comments from #24048. These changes include slightly more than Prettier formatting changes, so they have been cherry-picked.
items.title: Update /learn/forms/how_to_structure_a_web_form

items.content_html:
I've added three more examples to what it is, though maybe I'm wrong myself.

I've done this for a while and I've never heard what a call-out box is, seems more like a marketing terminology or something and I feel like more examples of what that is, could be beneficial.

And while we do have <dialog> I'm not even sure if that is meant to be used for modals based on what I read about the <dialog> tag.

I think being more specific would help a lot instead of generalizing these things.

Perhaps adding even more examples where, and in dialog say that it woudln't be suitable for a 'modal', if its not, maybe someone can correct me here if I'm wrong.

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update: Gave more examples to what `call out boxes` is

items.content_html:
Description

I have shortened the intro text and included a procedure in css/first_steps/getting_started.

Motivation

Loving writing, I think the MDN texts are wordy in some places. I found this while learning CSS. In my opinion, numbered lists can help to structure the content.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Relates to #17417 (but only adds the procedure and improves its intro)
items.title: Shorten intro and add procedure

items.content_html:
Description

This fixes #23606 which completes the lack of documentation for selectionStart , selectionStop and selectionDirection

Motivation

An issue was raised regarding the lack of documentation for certain key elements on a page, I have documented the necessary information which gives a better understanding to the user reading the documentation
items.title: Fixes #23606

Additional details

items.content_html: This PR is a part of a project to format all of the documents using Prettier, and then enforce Prettier formatting for the files going forward. This PR formats the /web/api folder for APIs starting with X through Z.
items.title: Format /web/api/[x-z]* using Prettier
